mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Julia Ann Blackburn Washington to John Frobel, Richmond, Virginia, 1804 February 11
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, Julia Ann Blackburn, 1768-1829
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Ann Washington writes to assure Frobel that he will be able to get many pupils if he comes to Alexandria shortly -- several people have promised to send children to him, including Dr. Dick -- she wishes he could come soon -- Bushrod Washington will send his schooner to Richmond for Frobel if possible, though Col. Washington's may get to Richmond sooner -- she wishes to see him an "inmate" at Mt. Vernon -- he will have at Mt. Vernon her 3 nieces and a nephew of her husband's who lives with them. Name on original manuscript appears as "Ann Washington". Autograph letter signed, 3 pages, integral cover, postmarked "Washn. City Feb. 13", broken seal with arm, laminated.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Music
